column70: Custom field ([CHART] Date of First Response)

column1: Wrong username message doesn't say about symbols
column30:
When typing *wrong* username*, popup* message doesn’t indicate that there are symbols in the filled-in username.

!image-20230320-095314.png|width=316,height=171!

*Proposal:* Popup message states that there are special characters used, e.g. *“Username must consist of no less than 6 letters AND numbers”* OR *“Username consists of letters and digits only”.*

column1: [Enter] does not go to [Create Account] button
column30: After filling in correct input, I should wish after pressing [*Enter*], to be the same as pressing the [*Create Account*] button.

column1: "Redirecting" message popup is not user friendly
column30:
When I use *valid* username, e-mail and password, after clicking the [*Create Account*] button, there’s a *popup* window (alert), which says “*Redirecting*”. It is *not* user friendly.

!image-20230320-094752.png|width=331,height=227!

*Proposal*: Something similar may be used:

!image-20230320-094800.png|width=393,height=171!

*Error messages* aren’t user friendly visually AND require pressing the [*OK*] button.

!image-20230320-094454.png|width=353,height=92!

*Proposal:* Some message with red letters could appear next to the incorrectly filled field. Please see below:

!image-20230320-094506.png|width=372,height=154!

When I press the *[Back]* button after successful registering, the site *remembers* all my data *inputs*.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Enter valid username, password and e-mail in the registration form. (e.g. Username: username; E-mail: [gosho@abv.bg|mailto:gosho@abv.bg]; Password: Passw0rd$).
#  Click [*Create Account*].
# Wait until the popup window saying “*Redirecting*” appears.
!image-20230320-094326.png|width=362,height=127!
# Click [*OK*] from the pop up window.
# Wait to be redirected to the *“You are now logged in.”* page.
!image-20230320-094332.png|width=362,height=140!
# Press the [*Back*] button.
!image-20230320-094337.png|width=362,height=204!
# The page remembers the data input from earlier fill-in.
!image-20230320-094342.png|width=358,height=254!

 *Proposal*: Clear all data after registering to the site.

column1: Username field accepts too long input
column30:
*_Username_* field accepts too *long* input.

!image-20230320-093904.png|width=359,height=237!

*Examples*: “userkdjhfadifvh8927465294765jkhvbskjfdhbvjks4875”.

*Proposal*: Put an upper limit for characters used in _Username_ field.

Currently there *isn’t* option to *see* what the *password* is while typing.

!image-20230320-095708.png|width=543,height=116!



*Proposal*: There could be implemented some hint for showing password, e.g. the one below:

!image-20230320-093648.png|width=276,height=127!

column1: Popup message for redirecting needs [OK] click from user
column30:
When I use *valid* username, e-mail and password, after clicking the [*Create Account*] button, there’s a *popup* window (alert), which says “Redirecting”. I’m *not* *redirected* until I *press* the [*OK*] button from the popup window.

*Steps to reproduce:* 

# Enter *valid* username, password and e-mail in the registration form. (e.g. Username: username; E-mail: [gosho@abv.bg|mailto:gosho@abv.bg]; Password: Passw0rd$)
#  Click [*Create Account*]
# Wait until the *popup* window saying “*Redirecting*” appears.
!image-20230320-093143.png|width=359,height=126!
# Do not click [*OK*] from the pop up window.
# Wait to see that you are *not* redirected at all.

Proposal: Remove the need for clicking [*OK*] button by the user.
Using [*Tab*] button to move through fields isn’t visible when on [*Clear Form*] OR [*Create Account*] buttons.

column1: Wrong text in popup window message for invalid password
column30:
*Popup* window *message* for invalid password is *wrong*:

Instead of “*numbers*” or “*digits*” the popup message says “*Numeric letter*”, which is something completely different (X, V, I, etc.)

Instead of “*field*” it says “*filed*”.

!image-20230320-092348.png|width=324,height=111!

The text says *“Confirm Email :”* instead of *“Confirm Password:”.*

!image-20230320-092149.png|width=326,height=179!

*“Account”* is written incorrectly. It shouldn’t be “*Acount*”.

!image-20230320-092037.png|width=326,height=182!

When I press the *[Clear Form*] button, I expect to have all fields cleared from data.

Instead *nothing happens* when I press it.

*Note*: However, the “Refresh” button does it.

!image-20230320-091916.png|width=320,height=235!

The message after successful registration should be  *“You are now logged in.”.*

However, it is *“Thank you for registering.”* instead. 

!image-20230320-091613.png|width=320,height=140!

*Password* requirement is not met. 

Password with *five* (5) characters is *accepted*:

!image-20230320-090641.png|width=324,height=248!

*Example*: “As12#”, “Qw34%”

The requirement is: _“_*_Password_* _should be_ *_minimum 6 characters_* _and_ *_maximum 12 characters_*_._ *_Uppers case, lower case, number,_* _and_ *_special character_* *_required._*_”_

*_Username_* field *accepts* input with *four* (4) and *five* (5) alphanumeric *characters*.

*Examples*: “user”, “qwert”.

*Proposal*: Either change the requirements, OR fix the issue.

*Requirement:* Currently it is: _“_*_no less than 6_* *_letters AND numbers_*_”._

!image-20230320-090458.png|width=323,height=226!

*Site:* [https://register-form.softuniqa.repl.co/|https://register-form.softuniqa.repl.co/]

As a user, when I click on the submit button, it disappears.

*Expected behavior:* When I click on the submit button, it submits the form as per specification.

*Actual behavior:* When I click on the submit button it disappears and does not do anything else.

*System:* Windows 10, Chrome
